facts.fact_text: The STOXX 50 climbed 0.7% and the STOXX 600 rose 0.4%.

evidences.evidence_text: European equities rebounded on Friday, with the STOXX 50 climbing 0.7% and the STOXX 600 rising 0.4%, after a lacklustre start to the session.

facts.fact_text: ASML Holding was up 1.3%, Siemens added 1.8%, and Rheinmetall surged 4.3%.

evidences.evidence_text: Gains were led by industrial and technology names, with ASML Holding up 1.3%, Siemens adding 1.8%, and Rheinmetall surging 4.3%.

facts.fact_text: Novo Nordisk jumped more than 5% after the US FDA threatened action against illegal copycat drugs.

evidences.evidence_text: Novo Nordisk jumped more than 5% after the US FDA threatened action against illegal copycat drugs.

facts.fact_text: Vinci soared over 8% after reporting higher revenues while Orsted advanced 1.7% following a 9.8% annual increase in revenues.

evidences.evidence_text: Vinci soared over 8% after reporting higher revenues while Orsted advanced 1.7% following a 9.8% annual increase in revenues.

facts.fact_text: Stellantis plunged 27% after warning it expects to take a €22 billion hit from restructuring its business to accelerate the rollout of electric and hybrid vehicles.

evidences.evidence_text: On the downside, Stellantis plunged 27% after warning it expects to take a €22 billion hit from restructuring its business to accelerate the rollout of electric and hybrid vehicles.

facts.fact_text: Societe Generale fell 3.8% after its results disappointed.

evidences.evidence_text: Societe Generale fell 3.8% after its results disappointed.

facts.fact_text: For the week so far, the STOXX 50 is down 0.3%, while the broader STOXX 600 has edged up 0.1%.

evidences.evidence_text: For the week so far, the STOXX 50 is down 0.3%, while the broader STOXX 600 has edged up 0.1%.

evidence.evidence_text: Stellantis plunged 27% after warning it expects to take a €22 billion hit from restructuring its business to accelerate the rollout of electric and hybrid vehicles.
